revised_title: Detecting Motion in Nerve Ganglia using Light-Beating Spectroscopy
tldr: Researchers used light-beating spectroscopy to study motion in locust nerve ganglia. They discovered that exposing the ganglia to high-potassium solutions or electrical stimulation increased the level of motion within the preparation. The findings suggest that depolarization induces particle motion in nerve cells and may be related to a partial liquefaction of the axoplasm caused by calcium ions entering the cells.
